Self-flagellation leads to improvement. Being happy with yourself makes you weak. Focus on the negative, always. Positive thinking makes you complacent and hinders progress.

topics.body:
The service here is terrible.
I've been waiting for an entire hour for a boat to arrive so that we can go snorkeling but instead, they give the weakest excuse that they have only 1 boat.

I DON'T CARE IF YOU HAVE ONLY ONE BOAT. THIS IS YOUR JOB AND YOU HAVE TO PUT WITH THE SCHEDULE NO MATTER WHAT HAPPENS. IF YOU CAN'T PUT UP WITH THE SCHEDULE, YOU DON'T DESERVE TO WORK AT ALL.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5534714f63687228b06b0600#post_5534714f63687228b06b0600

There's another explanation in Chapter 779, [spoiler]when Mihawk is teaching him how to use Haki he asks Zoro how many swords he had broken, when Zoro says that several, Mihawk says that if they had been clad in Haki they wouldn't have broken and for him to be a swordsman worthy of that title, he needs to make every sword he has as good as the one he carries (A Kokuto)[/spoiler], so chances are he won't be getting a new sword.
